inn1.comm: bit of inswing, was that? Medium-paced delivery, and it's signalled leg-byes after he gets his front foot across and misses as he tries to play around the ball. Trickles down towards fine leg. That was extremely close. Looked to be heading towards leg stump.

this one's definitely out. Nice and full, and there's that inswing again. Rahane's front pad is planted right in front of middle stump, and the ball thuds into it nice and low as he tries to work the ball across the line. Umpire Dharmasena immediately raises his finger.
and he gets off the mark with a lovely shot, driven to the left of mid-off after taking a confident stride forward
again his front leg comes right across the crease, and again he misses the flick, and again it goes off his pad. This one was definitely angling down leg, and it runs away to the fine leg boundary
this one straightens and beats Uthappa's prod outside off. Lovely bowling, this
again that front-and-across stride. More across than forward, and he defends this back of a length ball, which comes in a touch from outside off, with a straight bat into the leg side
that's back of a length, wide outside off, and Pujara lets it go as it moves away a touch off the seam
bit of away movement again and lots of bounce, from wide outside off. Pujara's bat is drawn to it for a moment, but he lets it go quite easily in the end
ooh. That was angled in, and Pujara played for the angle, but it straightened just a touch and beat his defensive shot
this one also straightened a little bit, but Pujara was aware it might happen and poked it into the off side with nice soft hands
soft hands again, and that saved Pujara. It was a strange sort of attempted dab to third man, and he gets an outside edge that falls well short of first slip
onto the pads this time, and a nice bit of fielding at square leg, a dive to the right (I'm not sure who the fielder is) denies him the single after he plays the flick
this is fullish, outside off, and he comes nicely forward to drive to cover
bit of inswing again, from back of a length, but it's quite a bit wide of off and Uthappa lets it go
that leaves him from a fullish length outside off and he leaves again
angled in towards off, and he comes forward and drops it down in front of point and sets off for a quick single. Pujara has to dive into the crease in the end but he's safe
angled in from wide of the crease, and he defends back to the bowler
cut in off the seam a bit, and Pujara, who is on the jump, inside-edges it onto his pads
back of a length, wide of off, and Uthappa leaves it alone
comes in a touch from back of a length, and it's pretty close to off. Uthappa leaves again
that's too full and on the pads, and he gets his bat down in front of that front pad and glances it neatly to the fine leg boundary. That went very fine
Whoa. That was a short ball that Uthappa looked to duck under and ended up periscoping it, off the back of his bat, towards fine leg after it came in off the seam
short ball, not too wide though, and Pujara can't get his cut away. Drops it down into the off side
angled in from back of a length, and Pujara defends off the back foot
back of a length, and he's punched it into the covers
angled in again, and a bit of movement in as well, and Uthappa removes his bottom hand to poke it away into the leg side
short, wide outside off, and dies on its way to the keeper after Uthappa leaves it
wide outside off again and Uthappa leaves again
a bit fuller, a bit closer to off, but not close enough to tempt Uthappa into a shot
beaten! Kept low again and went on the bounce to the keeper after it beat Uthappa's outside edge as he prodded outside off after shuffling across the crease
starts with a bouncer, and Pujara doesn't really have to duck or sway to let it go over his head
short again, outside off this time, and Pujara leaned back to let it go. Two for the over, the umpire signals
short, way outside off, and the umpire calls it wide as Pujara lets it go
back of a length, and Pujara punches it back to the bowler off the back foot
waits on this one and opens his bat face to run it down to third man
back of a length, outside off, and he opens his face and guides it to the right of third man
comes in a bit off the pitch, and he tucks it into the leg side off his waist
straightens a touch, and Pujara edges it, prodding from the crease, but plays late and it drops in front of second slip, diving to his right
lets this back of a length ball come on to him and dinks it into the off side and sets off immediately
strangled appeal as Pujara is hit high on the pads after a half stride forward. It was angling down the leg side and going over too
full, just outside off, and he drives with a closed face towards mid-on
angled in and nips away late, and Pujara is beaten, his bat is left hanging forlornly outside off stump
short, wide, and Pujara cuts but can't beat Shakib, who dives to his right to stop this at point
that's full, outside off, and he takes a big stride across and drives, with a slightly slicing motion, through squarish cover. It went just in front of point, actually
back of a length, and he's timed this punch very nicely in the gap between point and cover
bit of inward movement off the pitch, and he's hit on the midriff as he presses half-forward to it
short, outside off, and moving away a touch. Why exactly was he looking to pull that? He goes for it, and top-edges it high up and down into the hands of mid-off. First ODI wicket for Taskin
that's just back of a length and moving away a touch from outside off. Rayudu leaves it alone
back of a length outside off again, and Rayudu lets it go again
unplayable! That was angling in from fairly wide of the crease, pitching on off, and Pujara had to play at it. He did, and it cut away and beat his outside edge and went screaming over off stump
waits on it this time, opens his face a touch, and dabs it behind square for a quick single
back of a length outside off and he's deep in his crease to poke it towards point
whoa! Rayudu is squared up and beaten as this seams away sharply from back of a length after angling in towards off stump
bit of bounce after angling in, and Rayudu drops his bottom hand to defend this
on the pads this time, and he tucks it towards midwicket
given! That looked out for sure as he prodded forward, but not a long way forward, and the ball seamed in and hit his pad in front of middle-and-off, and the umpire doesn't hesitate at all
back of a length, and too straight. Raina gets off his toes and tucks it off his hip to get off the mark
shortish ball, loads of carry and Mushfiq takes that high above his head after Pujara lets it go
not as much bounce this time, but similar line and Pujara leaves again
bangs this in, and he ducks into a low crouch to let that pass over his head
back of a length outside off and Pujara leaves again
angled across, starts from just outside off, and Raina leaves it alone
short, wide, and he punches that sweetly past point
straighter now, angling towards off, and he goes back in his crease and tucks the ball down to deep backward square leg
waits on this one, and flicks it with a lot of bottom hand, from off stump, towards square leg
keeps a touch low from just back of a length, and Raina defends into the off side with a straight bat
squared up a little by the angle, and by the extra bounce, and he edges this down to third man, on the hop
short, sits up chest high, and Raina pulls confidently past square leg
back of a length, and Raina shuffles across and tucks it off his pads towards fine leg
too straight now, and he clips it off his pads towards deep square leg
short, and it sails way over Raina's head as he ducks under it
onto Raina's pads once more, and he clips it just behind square leg
muted appeal for lbw, as the ball angles into Pujara and he defends down the wrong line, off the back foot, but it struck him way too high to be given, and it was angling down the leg side
bit of extra bounce, was there? Raina takes his bottom hand off his handle to defend into the off side
top-edges this attempted pull as he swivels round to this shortish ball, and it goes way over the keeper's head and bounces down to the boundary

fuller this time, but he's still deep in his crease, shuffling across to tuck it into the on side. Dives into the crease as Mortaza chases, turns around, and hits the stumps direct at the bowler's end. Goes up to the third umpire but he's well in. Runs away for four overthrows
back of a length, angling in, and keeps a touch low. Pujara defends off the back foot
onto the pads now, but that's because Pujara has shuffled across. Tucks this down to fine leg
back of a length, angling across with some extra bounce. Raina is hit high on the bat, on the sticker, but he plays with soft hands down into the slips
short and wide and he cuts it uppishly but safely, bounces down to third man
onto the pads, and Raina falls over as he tries to take off for a quick single after shuffling across and clipping it towards midwicket
angled across, and he goes deep in his crease, opens his bat face, and dabs it down behind square

gone! that came back in, and Pujara was hit on the back pad, in front of the stumps, as he tried to defend from halfway forward. Ball went between bat and pad. He didn't bring his bat down quick enough, and it came down from around second slip
angled in towards middle, and straightens just a touch from a pretty full length. Saha blocks it with a nice straight bat
length ball outside off, and he comes forward to defend into the off side
angled across, and Raina defends towards cover off the back foot
short, sits up, and he pulls it from just outside off towards deep square leg
a touch too straight, and he works this off his pads, wide of mid-on
angled in, and a bit of bounce as Saha comes forward. Takes his bottom hand off and the ball hits him precisely on that bottom glove
pokes forward outside off, one-handed, no bottom hand again, and manages to get it down despite the ball hitting the bat near its shoulder
goes back and waits on this to dab it towards point
shortish ball, and he gets off the ground to cut that towards point
full, on off stump, and he closes his bat face to play a checked drive towards mid-on
short, and angling well down the leg side as Saha ducks under it
short, wide, and he cuts from a strange, closed position and hits it straight to point
beauty! He came forward to that, and it cut back sharply off the pitch, bounced, and went between bat, pad, and missed everything
wide outside off this time, and Saha lets it go
angled in, straightened a tiny bit, and he gets behind the line to defend off the back foot
Shakib dives to his right at point and stops this, after Raina goes back to this ball angled across him and steers it with an open face
shuffles across and is in front of off stump to tuck this from outside off towards midwicket
shortish, straightish, and he shuffles across and works it past square leg off his hip
full, on off, and he drives this wristily over the umpire's head for four! He was too early into his shot, actually, and was initially looking to drive through mid-off
got him! that's very full, and he's pinged him in front of off, on the toes, and it's angled towards the stumps. He was batting outside his crease, but there wasn't too much doubt about that

that's too straight, angled onto the pads, and he tucks it down to deep square leg. Oh, hang on, there's a run-out here! The throw, wisely, is to the bowler's end after Raina turns blind, without changing his hands, at the striker's end. He had taken his gloves off and was holding them in his hands while he ran. He's well outside the crease as Mashrafe removes the bails. The ball's slipped out of his hands and hit the stumps, actually. And on comes the red light!
that's on the stumps, and he's flicked it nonchalantly over mid-on's head
back of a length, angled across, and he gets behind the line to defend off the back foot
back of a length, and he's punched that sweetly through square-ish cover. Top shot!
back of a length, way down the leg side, and he shuffles across to let it go
angled across, a touch fuller and outside off, and Akshar is drawn out to it and is beaten by the angle as he pokes at it
Akshar's supremely confident innings comes to an early close, he was looking to work this one to the leg side, he misses and the ball crashes into the stumps
short, angling in from just outside off, and Mishra drops his gloves out of the way in ungainly but effective fashion
full, on the stumps, and midwicket fumbles a touch as he flicks it towards him
short of a length, held its line just outside off, defended off a half-forward-press
full, but slides this way down the leg side
full, outside off, and Mishra's feet don't move as he tries to drive it, and it beats his outside edge. Don't think that moved away too much
length ball, outside off, and he comes forward to defend towards cover
shortish, angling in towards off stump, and he goes back to defend into the off side
back of a length again, angled towards middle, and he defends into the on side without really getting behind the line
that's angled sharply in from wide of the crease, and he's struck on the front pad mid-shuffle, but it's definitely going down leg
this time, he overdoes the angle and it slips down the leg side for a wide
angled in, towards off, and he's struck on the front pad but he'd gotten a good stride that took him outside the line, and he got an inside edge on it as well
back of a length outside off and he defends this towards point
that's a dangerous looking front-and-across step, but he manages to bring his bat down in time and clip this fullish ball down towards fine leg
comes forward to drive this full ball outside off, and hits it to mid-off off the inside half of the bat
angled down the leg side again, and he shuffles across and tucks it off his hip to fine leg. Oh, wait, the umpire's signalled leg byes, so he might not have gotten any bat on it
back of a length outside off, and he defends towards cover off the back foot
shortish ball, and Mishra tries to steer it wide of point but hits it straight towards him instead
full this time and he drives it to the left of cover. Doesn't quite time it like he would have wanted to
short, wide, and Binny slashes and misses
gives him width again, and he attempts to play a weird-looking slice from halfway forward. Gets a healthy edge through to the keeper. I guess he was looking to hit it behind point
angled in and straightens from a fullish length, and Mohit is beaten as he tries to drive on the up through the off side
full, angling in, and Mishra defends towards short leg
that's wide outside off and he drives to cover
goes with the arm from outside off and he waits on it to play a late cut behind point
full, flighted ball on off stump, and he pokes it towards mid-on for the quick single
comes forward to this one, pushes his hands out, and steers it past slip off the outside half of his bat. Or it was simply an outside edge, high up the bat
soft hands now, and the edge drops short of second slip

that's a five-for on debut! that's full, on the stumps, and he tried to flick it square, across the line. Hit him on the back pad, but he was deep in his crease, so I guess that would have hit leg stump
that's full, and he's driven it confidently to mid-off
ho ho! He's gone after that, slogging across the line after clearing his front leg. Doesn't quite get hold of it and it goes down to mid-on, all along the ground
angled in, jagged away off the pitch, and he poked and missed with no footwork
short, wide outside off, and he tries to pull but hits it off the bottom of his bat, to the right of mid-off
what a shot! That's full, and he's driven that sweetly, with a straight bat, over the bowler's head and well wide of mid-off
angled in, turns away from just outside off, and he gets a thickish outside edge down past point as he comes forward to defend
it's slower and wider, and he prods forward and gets another outside edge, past the diving Mortaza at slip
tries to steer this towards third man after pressing forward, ends up inside-edging it onto his pads
tossed up, outside off, and he leaves it alone
this one goes with the angle, and he defends into the on side off the inside half of his bat
short, but it doesn't come on, and he slaps it to mid-off after initially looking to cut
that's full, angling in, and straightens off the pitch. Defends it back to the bowler
shortish ball, angled towards middle, and he's punched it towards point
shortish rising ball, and he jumps up to defend this down towards the bowler
shortish again. He seemed to shape for the pull but decided against it and blocked it back to the bowler

another short ball, more of an effort ball this time, and it follows Umesh as he tries to sway out of line. Doesn't drop his hands, and it goes off his outside edge, over first slip, and runs away to the boundary
whoa! that's short, and he went for the pull without any hesitation, and smacked it high over the wide long on boundary
back of a length, on off, and he defends into the off side off the back foot
fuller now, and he drives it down to long-off
that's it! He slogs across the line, and gets a thick outside edge that ricochets off Mushfiq's thigh behind the wicket and loops into the hands of first slip

inn2.comm: he's slapped that hard through cover after coming down the track and giving himself room. Positive start!

he's gone! He's come out looking to go after everything, and you wonder why he's doing this. It was angled towards off stump, he tried to lash it over the covers, and gets a thick edge through to the keeper
shortish, wide outside off, and he lets it go
back of a length, curving away a touch, and he punches it towards point to get off the mark in ODI cricket
wide outside off, and he slashes and misses as it curls away a touch
bit of inward movement off the seam from back of a length, and he defends into the on side after dropping his bottom hand
outswing, and moves away even more after hitting the pitch, but it's wide enough for Mithun to let it go
that's full, just outside off, and he drives with a nice straight bat between cover and mid off
straighter, and gets a bit of movement away from middle, but he goes back and across to get behind the line and defend
that's a wild thrash at the ball, full, wide and curving away, and he's beaten
too straight now, and he's tucked it off his legs to the fine leg boundary
back of a length, in the corridor, with a bit of away movement, and he lets it go
back of a length outside off, and he shuffles across to defend towards cover
lovely delivery, moves away sharply outside off, and he pokes at it and misses without really getting forward
back of a length, comes in a touch, and he defends back to the bowler off the back foot
swings in this time, and he's hit on the front pad as he defends down the wrong line, but it was going down the leg side
that's the full, wide outswinger, and he throws his bat at it once again and he's beaten once again
that's a soft dismissal. It's short and it's moving away from him, and he pokes at it and middles, but only manages to hit it uppishly and straight to point
exaggerated outswing from a fullish length, just outside off, and Mithun lets it go
oooh. That was angled in towards middle-and-off and it moved away a lot, and he was poking at it well outside off when he was beaten
he's bowled this too wide, and it's moved away even more, and he couldn't have got any bat on it even if he'd tried
shorter this time, and he defends it by his feet without moving across. He kind of tapped downwards over the top of the ball
a touch fuller now, and he pokes it towards point. No feet at all
short, rising towards the batsman's head. He's gone for the hook, and it's gone off the back of his bat over the keeper's head
he isn't really controlling the swing too well. This one's way outside off once again
that's not too close to off stump either, but it's close enough for Umesh to be able to walk to the umpire and take his cap, after Mithun lets it go
short and wide, and he's cut that very crisply, but Rahane dives to his left at backward point and makes a super stop
angled in towards off this time, and straightened only a tiny bit. Gets nicely behind the line to defend
that came in off the seam a touch, but it was wide enough and short enough for Mushfiq to let it go easily
fuller now, and it straightens from just outside off, but Mushfiq waits and plays it late to dab it towards point
that's well outside off, and he leaves it alone
back of a length, outside off, and Mushfiq lets it go. It's time for a dinner break!
loads of away movement from off stump, and he pokes at it with no feet and is opened up completely
this is fuller, and he comes halfway forward and is beaten as he tries to drive on the up through the off side
gets a thick edge onto this as he pokes once more, from the crease, and it hits the shoulder of his bat and bounces over the head of second slip
he's sprayed that way down the leg side, I assume trying to produce that magic delivery that pitches leg and hits off
squares him up again as it moves away from a middle-and-off line. Keeps it down somehow and it trickles towards point
way down the leg side once again. This is the fourth wide he's bowled, and it's only his third over
full, swinging away from outside off, and he lets it go
back of a length, straightening from middle and off, and he gets nicely behind the line to defend off the back foot
that keeps low, and it hits him on the back thigh as he tries to pull and plays well over the ball. Would have gone over the stumps, I think, and the umpire thought so too, after Mohit appealed
shortish ball, comes back in from outside off, and he tries to punch through the off side but doesn't middle it at all
short and wide and he's slashed that behind point. Umesh runs around at third man to cut it off at the boundary
shortish again, and he punches it well, but straight to cover
comes back sharply from outside off. He was looking to cut but had to pull his bottom hand off and drop the ball down into the off side
length ball, outside off, and he lets it go
bit of movement away from just back of a length, on off, and he covers his stumps and lets it go
drifts onto the pads, and he's clipped it neatly down to the deep backward square leg boundary
short this time, too straight again, and he's tucked it off his hip down to fine leg
back of a length, angling in towards off, and he opens his bat face to poke it towards point
away movement and bounce, but it's too short and too wide for Mithun to bother playing at it
too short again, even if it's closer to the stumps, and he can wait on the back foot to defend into the off side
angled in, and it bounces extra, and he's hit on the midriff as he looks to work it into the leg side
comes in off the pitch from back of a length, and he goes back to defend in front of off stump
short and wide and moving away, and he's beaten as he tries to cut

bit of bounce again as this angles in from back of a length, and he gets an inside edge on that as he drops his bottom hand to defend. Goes up in the air but drops safely down and bounces down towards fine leg
full, wide, and he's come forward and driven that confidently through square cover
that's short and it moved away and bounced, and it hits high on the bat as he tries to punch towards point. Ends up hitting it uppishly but safely down to third man
that's back of a length, outside off, and comes slowly onto the batsman, who punches it to cover
bit of bounce there, and he tucks it into the leg side, not entirely in control, as he takes his bottom hand off the handle
that's a fullish outswinger, and he's beaten as he pokes forward at it
shorter now, and he waits on it and dabs it towards point
length ball, moving away from outside off, and he lets it go
that seams away a long way, and he's opened up and beaten comprehensively as he tries to defend off the back foot
back of a length, outside off, doesn't come on at all as he shapes to punch, and he pushes it into the covers
that's too straight, middle-and-leg, and he's glanced that neatly off his pads to the fine leg boundary
angled in towards off, fairly full, and he defends carefully into the off side
that jags away a long way off the pitch, and it beats him by what seems like half a foot as he pokes from the back foot. A touch too short to get the edge
that's full, outside off, and he keeps his bat perfectly straight and leans into it to push it into the covers
whoa! It was full and angled in and it moved sharply away. Mithun walked into that attempted defensive push down the ground, and the ball beat his outside edge and just missed off stump
seams away from outside off and Mushfiq lets it go
seams away from off stump. It's short enough for Mushfiq to watch it all the way and let it go
fuller, but still too wide of off stump to draw the batsman into a shot

goes wide of the crease this time, and he's got his man! that straightened a touch from leg stump as he tried to tuck it down to fine leg. Ends up gloving it, and it loops up down the leg side to the wicketkeeper
muted appeal as that swings in and hits him on the front pad as he looks to work it into the on side. But he got an inside edge, was well forward, and it might have pitched outside leg too
fuller now, and he drives down to mid-off
that's another wide. Lots of outswing, but it started from way outside off
tries to leave this outside off, and the ball hits his bat just as he's withdrawing it, and it runs down towards third man
nice shot. That was swinging in from just outside off, and he waited on it and manouevred his bat-face to try and steer it past cover, but Rahane dived to his right to make a good stop
that's full and wide, and he's slapped that hard behind square and it's gone screaming away to the boundary
angled across, and he shuffles across to defend back to the bowler
full, outside off, and he drives to mid-off with a nice high right elbow
shortish, and he chops down on it well but Raina dives to his left at backward point to make the stop
whoa. Once again, Mithun is on the walk as this fullish ball seams away and beats his attempted drive down the ground
soft dismissal! that was on the pads, and he could have flicked that anywhere he pleased, but he flicked it uppishly, straight to square leg

and he gets another! that was an amiable full delivery wide outside off, and it didn't move that much at all, but he slices the ball straight to gully, where it bounces up off Rayudu's palms before he takes it easily on the second attempt
angled in, straightened a touch, and he brings his bat down quickly to push it down towards mid-on
onto the pads, and Binny has conceded his first run, after he tucks it in front of square leg
full, on the pads once more, and he clips it towards square leg. Was a touch uppish at the start, but dropped well short of the fielder

that's the ball of the day! angled across, and it moved away a touch more and bounced as well, and got a little big on Shakib, and kissed the edge, near the shoulder of his bat as he looked to defend into the covers. They checked for no ball, but he had a decent amount of heel behind the line
full, outside off, and he drives to mid-off
down the track, and he's slogged that, and he's miscued that, hitting it way up in the air. It was the back of the hand slower ball from Mohit, and Akshar Patel gets under it at square leg
short, comes in from off, and he chops it down behind square. Binny runs in from third man and slips and skids on the outfield as he fields it
back of a length, outside off, and he pushes it into the covers off the back foot
seams away from back of a length, extra bounce as well, and he gets on his toes to push it into the off side
full, off-stump yorker almost, and he digs it out to mid-off
short, outside off, and he drops his gloves to let it go
this is fuller, and he comes forward and gets nice and close to the ball to push it into the covers
beaten! that seamed away from a good length, and Mortaza thrust his foot across and prodded uncertainly at it

He has a fourth now! This was a very difficult ball to play. It was angled in from wide of the crease and left him from around an off-stump line. He had to play at it, and he edged it through to Saha, who caught it near his right shoulder
angled across, and he comes forward to defend into the covers
bit of bounce from back of a length. Nasir moves away from the line and defends into the off side
that's wide outside off, and he's let it go
back of a length, angling in, and he defends back to the bowler off the back foot. Again, he played that from next to the line of the ball
short, wide and slapped away nicely but he won't get any runs for it. Rahane moves across to his right to make a smart stop at point
slower ball, but he doesn't get it right, and it slants well down the leg side
shortish, wide, and Uthappa dives across from a wide slip to take the pace off the ball after Nasir cuts
that's right up to the batsman, just outside off, and he defends solidly into the covers with a straight bat
that seams away from outside off but doesn't get up at all. He pokes at it, gets the bottom of his bat on it, and it bounces down to the keeper

bowled him, and he has five! That was a full, wide outswinger that he could have driven for four if he'd gotten his front foot across, but his feet didn't move at all and he threw his bat at it and inside-edged it onto his stumps
short, wide outside off, and it jags away as the batsman pulls his bat inside the line

that's it! Binny has the best figures by an Indian bowler in ODIs! He angles this in from wide of the crease, and it straightens and beats the outside edge as he looks to prod it towards mid-off. Pitched off, hit off, and another Karnataka bowler has dislodged Anil Kumble's 6 for 12 from the top of the pile
